thread.title: Free stuff: Save your energy for these events
thread.title_full: Free stuff: Save your energy for these events - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Free stuff: Save your energy for these events
text:

Photo: James Nielsen, Staff A board being broken during the taekwondo performance at the Korean... Image 4 of 9 The Korean Festival will take place at Discovery Green Park in the heart of downtown Houston.

Photo: R. Clayton McKee, Freelance KBR Kid's Day on the Bayou festival along the Sabine Promenade. Image 6 of 9 KBR Kids Day on Buffalo Bayou
Photo: Freelance KBR Kids Day on Buffalo Bayou Image 7 of 9 A giant katydid at the KBR Kids Day.
Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance A giant katydid at the KBR Kids Day. Image 8 of 9 The Fulshear Scarecrow Festival features a live scarecrow contest.
Photo: Courtesy Photo The Fulshear Scarecrow Festival features a live scarecrow contest. Image 9 of 9 Free stuff: Save your energy for these events 1 / 9 Back to Gallery KBR Kids Day
This annual event at Buffalo Bayou Park will take place on the new Brown Foundation Lawn of the Water Works . More than 15 nonprofits will provide hands-on learning opportunities for children. Families also can explore the park's new two-level play area, as well as rent bikes and paddle crafts.
When: 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday
Where: 105 Sabine
Information: buffalobayou.org
Energy Day Festival
Explore more than 70 interactive demonstrations and exhibits that showcase science, technology, engineering and mathematics at this free family-friendly event at downtown's Sam Houston Park. Festivities include games, contests and live music.
When: 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday
Where: 1000 Bagby
Information: energydayfestival.org
Fulshear Scarecrow Festival
A highlight of the free Fulshear Scarecrow Festival is its live scarecrow contest. Teams create living scarecrows that are judged on creativity and originality. This year's theme for the contest is "Decades '20s to Today." Other festivities include a carnival, live music, apple bobbing and pumpkin decorating.
When: 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday
Where: Cross Creek Ranch, FM 1463 at FM 1093
Information: crosscreektexas.com
Korean Festival
The seventh edition of this festival returns to Discovery Green to showcase Korean culture in Houston. Entertainment will include folk musicians, traditional dancing and tae kwon do demonstrations. Plenty of food vendors will be on hand for those wanting a taste of Korea.
When: 12 a.m.-9 p.m. Saturday
Where: 1500 McKinney
Information: koreanfestivalhouston.com
A Night on Market Square
Market Square Park celebrates its fifth anniversary with this block party that includes live music, Saint Arnold's Game Garden, art cars, food and fashion trucks and "The HOU Show With Mills and Antoine." The HOU Show is an interactive show that includes celebrity interviews, skits and videos.
When: 7 p.m. Saturday
Where: 301 Milam
Information: marketsquarepark.com
Discovery Green Flea by Night
Shop for one-of-a-kind works of art, clothing and collectibles at this monthly flea market at downtown's Discovery Green. Expect to find vintage jewelry, recycled and embellished clothing, organic products, housewares and plenty of old-fashioned kitsch.
When: 6-10 p.m. Saturday
Where: 1500 McKinney
Information: discoverygreen.com
